name: web-server

scripts._comments1: heroku will look at the start script to start our application
scripts._comments2: we define this dev script to avoid typing the nodemon command everytime during develoment (also easier for Operation team). so using this script we can type 'npm run dev' this script would execute succesfully even if nodemon is not installed globally as it's added as local dependency (development) and npm scripts can use dependencies that are configured locally in the package.json. this is a better approach (not to have global dependencies) as all dependencies (for Dev and Prod) would be installed when calling the npm install command

_comment3: nodemon is installed locally (in the DevDependecies) by running npm install nodemon --save-dev. By having it installed as Dev dependency, it would not be installed by deployment scripts (e.g. Heroku) when deploying the application, only 'dependencies' would be
